Articles.Content: Too much fuel then?

Too much fuel then?

Not really. If you launch a heavy variation it is made to lift heavy stuff.

The real rponblem is it is internal balanced off stock parts and they are OP themselves. the tanks actually are based off internal tank size and balanced to stock.

the engines themselves are nerfed as well. they have less thrust at sea level lol.

yeah you are suppose to use the other stages to get into orbit

I made a long 1.5 meter fuel tan with a 600 thrust rocket and attached 4 detachable 1m wide fuel tanks with a 600 (I think) thrust rocket on each and I had enough fuel in those four to reach the moon just about.
the next update they will be a tad more nerfed I suppose. But I hardly see a reason till game stock engines are balanced. other wise people will just use those instead of mine.

the next update they will be a tad more nerfed I suppose. But I hardly see a reason till game stock engines are balanced. other wise people will just use those instead of mine.

Yeah for the time being just leave em as is...after they do the final balancing on stock engines and fuel adjust your accordingly. just made another angara rocket and it worked first try again 8)
as much as i want to work on KO)SMOS currently (which is low for various reasons) I am currently repaying some debt to r4m0n. But mech jeb users will be happy/creeped out.
OOohhhhOOHhhh.... can we have a sneak-peak?
this one hopes that some control able engines show up so we can land our ships on their sides we does
all planned but got to start from the ground up currently still messing with KVTK.

it is probably just your mesh files rebuilding.
